title: [Large-scale] Mobile Learning-Based Language Intervention Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Usage Skills and Intermediate Proficiency in the Target Language
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens requiring language mediation skills (e.g., translation, communication) in daily life. Perform real-world problem-solving projects through mobile device-enabled self-directed learning and peer collaboration

learning_goals: Complete three or more projects utilizing language intervention strategies in mobile learning tools and blended learning environments
Develop one or more learner-customized language intervention materials applying constructivist scaffolding techniques (e.g., step-by-step feedback, peer collaboration)
Improve language mediation skills (e.g., accuracy, fluency) by over 20% through formative assessments during the learning process

resources: Language intervention apps (e.g., Grammarly, Google Translate)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
